page.lettertext:
fol.119r
May it please yo
r
good L. having written of late to
S
r
Robert Cecil
that w
ch
his H. will im
te to yo
r
L: I have
e lesse at this p
nt
to signifie unto yo
u
.
Count Maurice
purpose to surprise
Gertrudenberg
hath had some impeachment
, for w
ch
it hath not
bin attempted. Howbeit his forces were landed 4 daies since
&
e Easte
te of
e towne called Langstraet is kept by
Count
Hohenloo
w
th
2 regiment
of foote & certaine horse to
e nomb
r
of 2000 & more, who hath used great expedition in
[tecting]
his people, & hath planted alredy 10 peeces of battery, w
ch
I
think as this daie shall plaie uppon
e towne. Count Maurice
doth besiege
e west
te, but hath neither yet entrenched, nor begon
any worke wh
r
of we knowe not heere
e reason, but because
of his slacknes, & for
t
there have messengers passed between
him &
e Governo
r
Mons
r
de Magires, yt is conceaved
t
e
Governo
r
doth give some hope of composition. Whertoo yt is
thought he will yeeld
e rather because
t
Mons
r
de Waterdick
who hath bin Governo
r
once before, ys now againe appointed by
l
re
s out of
Spaine,
w
ch
discontenteth exceedingly Mons
r
de Magires
& all
e souldiers of his garrison. This is as much as is
p
nt
ly reported. This
Councel of estate
hath conferred heere
of late w
th
divers commissaries of this Country about
e
reformation of abuses in their musters aswell in
e Comp
ies
, that
are paid by her
Ma
tie
,
as of theyr owne entertenment / that w
ch
they do suppose to be amisse in
e Englishe, & to empeache
e
concurrence of the Comissaries of both contreys in taking
e
musters joyntly together, they have exhibited in writing to
e end
I should send it: as w
th
all they desire that for
e better
fourmance of those
s
vices, theyr late placcart of Musters
may be practised by her Hig
nes
Commissaries, & if yt shalbe found
that there ys any thing in it either against
e Treaty or oth
r
wise
faulty in w
at
respect soev
r
, they will enter into conference &
willingly redresse yt.
And thus I take my humble leave.
Hage. Ma
r
22 1592.
